adjectives.description: nonstandard (comparative more nonstandard, superlative most nonstandard)

entries.meaning: (linguistics) Not conforming to the standard variety, or to the language as used by the majority of its speakers.
examples: The resulting sequence of covert wh-pronoun + Complementiser has an overt counterpart in nonstandard varieties of English, as the following example (recorded from a BBC radio programme) illustrates: (91)      England put themselves in a position [whereby that they took a lot of credit for tonightʼs game] (Ron Greenwood, BBC radio 4)
Unlike the TV standard we are all accustomed to, the Web is the wild, wild West of video nonstandards.
